poem:
Title: Amid The Echo of Gunshots

In the metallic play of power,
an office birthed from death's flower,
'Red flags' flutters atop pole-towers,
a symphony of silence, immersive, dour.

In her hands policy, and yet more grief,
Life in Parkland taut, beyond belief.
Children schooled in the shadow of the thief,
Must we arm educators for relief?
